features.title: Seize Your Day.
features.description: Getting overwhelmed by looming assignments is not why you attend university. Samwise supports your sanity by presenting only what you need to be successful today.

features.title: Plan Ahead.
features.description: Seeing is believing. Add tasks with confidence as Samwise helps manage your workload days ahead. Work smarter, not harder.

features.title: Focus On What Matters.
features.description: Remembering every task required for a specific assignment is hard. Take the guesswork out of homework with subtasks that work for you. Samwise brings your deadlines into focus, one step at a time.

hero.subheader: Managing a full credit-load and a healthy life is difficult. As due dates approach, it becomes easy to misjudge the amount of work remaining for any given assignment. By creating your tangible timeline, completing work no longer means giving up sleep.

node.name: Matthew Epstein
node.about: I am a Junior studying Computer Science and pursuing a minor in Business from the Dyson School of Business. I enjoy consumerism, YouTube, buying new electronics, and lists of three or more items. When I am not pretending to study or attempting to finish my homework, you can find me in my bed, at Cafe Jennie, or at Target. I am currently watching way too much food videos on YouTube, and I am searching for a new area of video entertainment to explore. If you see me on campus, please say hello! I love meeting new people (but need improvement on my name recall)!

node.name: Michael Xing
node.about: Michael is a full stack developer who enjoys building things for people to use. He primarily works in Java and web technologies, but dabbles with anything and everything that looks remotely interesting. When not coding, he enjoys helping aspiring developers while TA'ing 2110 / 2112, playing the piano, or playing video games (not necessarily in that order).

node.name: Megan Yin
node.about: I began coding when I was 13 years old and since then I have developed my skills through computational biology research, robotics, project teams, and free-lance web development. Through these experiences, I’ve developed an interest in robotics, machine learning, venture capital, front-end development and financial modeling. In addition, I’ve discovered the best code is written together and I love spending weekends planning and hosting collegiate hackathons with BigRed//Hacks or working with my team Cornell Design & Tech Initiative on campus.

node.name: Sam Zhou
node.about: I am a full stack web developer with extensive experience in backend development in Kotlin/Java/NodeJS and frontend development with React/Angular Framework. Sam is interested in designing and developing extensible and scalable software systems as well as programming languages.

node.name: Vivian Shiu
node.about: I'm ABC: American-Brazilian-Chinese and a designer. I'm passionate about the unaware effects design can have on a person's life. Outside of school you can find me drinking an açai smoothie or petting dogs around campus. I love to play soccer, piano, doodle, and nap!

node.name: Michelle Park
node.about:
Hello! My name is Michelle Park and I believe there is power in digital experiences that are designed for humans, by a human.
I was born in South Korea, spent my childhood in both Hanoi and Ho Chi Minh City of Vietnam, and then grew up in Irvine, California. I believe that my experiences in growing up in different environments shaped me into the empathetic and fast-adapting person I am today. 
This past summer I ate lots of cake, explored new places by myself, sipped iced lattes, read books at a dog park, and went vintage store-hopping.
